intro: Acacallis, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, many of which are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, clustered blooms in shades of yellow, orange, and red. Acacallis species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
